data.title: Shuttles
data.meta_description: Learn more about Quinnipiac's shuttle system, connecting the Mount Carmel, York Hill and North Haven campuses, as well as Hamden, North Haven and New Haven.
data.text:
Shuttle Routes Overview

See below for full details and schedules for each of our shuttle routes.

Download the mobile app for live shuttle tracking

August Shuttle Schedule

Please note the following schedule for shuttles in August.

Monday, August 19

Bobcat Loop: 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. (blue and yellow shuttles)

York Hill / Mount Carmel Loop: 10 a.m. - 10 p.m. (red shuttle)

International students shuttle

Tuesday - Thursday, August 20-22

Bobcat Loop: 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. (blue and yellow shuttles)

Friday, August 23

Bobcat Loop: 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. (blue and yellow shuttles)

Shopping and Restaurants - Hamden and North Haven: 6 to 11 p.m.

Saturday, August 24

Bobcat Loop: 7 a.m. to 1 a.m. (blue and yellow shuttles)

Shopping and Restaurants - Hamden and North Haven: Noon to 8 p.m.

Sunday, August 25

Bobcat Loop: 8 a.m. to 1 a.m. (blue and yellow shuttles)

Shopping and Restaurants - Hamden and North Haven: 1 to 7 p.m.

Monday-Friday, August 26-30

Bobcat Loop: 6 a.m. to 1 a.m. (6-7 a.m. blue only; then blue and yellow shuttles)

York Hill / Mount Carmel Loop: 7 a.m. to 1 a.m. (7-8 a.m. red and orange; 8 a.m.-8 p.m. red, orange and gold shuttle; 8-10 p.m. red and orange)

Westwoods Parking Lot Loop: 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

North Haven Campus: 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.

Shopping and Restaurants - Hamden and North Haven: Wednesday, August 28 5 p.m. to 9 p.m.; Friday, August 30, noon to 8 p.m.

Saturday, August 31

Bobcat Loop: 8 a.m. to 1 a.m.

Shopping and Restaurants - Hamden and North Haven: Noon to 8 p.m.

Sunday, September 1

Bobcat Loop: 8 a.m. to 1 a.m.

Shopping and Restaurants - Hamden and North Haven: 1 to 7 p.m.

York Hill Campus

Union Station

Church & George Street Holiday Shuttle to Union Station University breaks Learn more about shuttles during university breaks

The university shuttle system runs ADA-compliant vehicles on each loop. We also offer additional as-needed assistance during the construction of the South Quad project on the Mount Carmel Campus. Students in need of compliant shuttles (typically because of disability or injury) should contact the Office of Student Accessibility to make arrangements.

1 This is a game-day shuttle to the M&T Bank Arena on the York Hill Campus

*Whitney Village and Theatre Arts Center are request-and-go after 8 p.m.

York Hill / Mount Carmel Loop

Monday through Friday

On Peak: 10 a.m. - 6 p.m., every 5-10 minutes

Off Peak: 7 a.m. - 10 a.m., and 6 p.m. - 8 p.m., every 10-15 minutes

The York Hill / Mount Carmel Loop connects students directly to and from York Hill Campus and Mount Carmel Campus, with a stop at the nearby Theatre Arts Center. Early in the morning and later in the evening, two shuttles run continually and arrive at each campus approximately every 10 to 15 minutes. During the peak hours of the day, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., three shuttles service this loop with arrival times approximately every 5 to 10 minutes.

Stops include:

Mount Carmel Campus (New Road stop)

York Hill Campus (Rocky Top Student Center)

York Hill Campus (Crescent/Eastview)

Theatre Arts Center on Sherman Avenue

Bobcat Transit Shuttle Loop

Weekdays, 6 a.m. - 1 a.m.

On Peak: 7 a.m. - 11 p.m., every 10-15 minutes

Off Peak: 6 a.m. - 7 a.m., and 11 p.m. - 1 a.m., every 20-30 minutes

Weekends, 8 a.m. - 1 a.m.

On Peak: 8 a.m. - 11 p.m., every 10-15 minutes

Off Peak: 11 p.m. - 1 a.m., every 20-30 minutes

The Bobcat Transit shuttle loop connects the Mount Carmel and York Hill campuses with additional smaller stops along the way. It runs 7-days per week.

Stops include:

Mount Carmel Campus (New Road stop)

York Hill Campus (Rocky Top Student Center)

York Hill Campus (Crescent/Eastview)

Whitney Village on Whitney Avenue

After 8 p.m., the Whitney Village stop becomes request-and-go

Westwoods Parking Lot Loop

Monday through Friday

7 a.m. - 8 p.m., every 5-10 minutes

The Westwoods Parking Lot is open to every Quinnipiac-registered vehicle. Park your car securely in the Westwoods Parking Lot, which is 0.6 miles from the Mount Carmel Campus, then hop on the shuttle for an easy ride to campus.

Stops include:

Mount Carmel Campus (New Road stop)

Westwoods Parking Lot on West Woods Road (see the lot on a map)

North Haven Campus Shuttle Loop

Monday - Friday

7 a.m. - 11 p.m., hourly*

The North Haven Campus shuttle route connects students from the Mount Carmel and York Hill campuses and the Whitney Village apartments to the North Haven Campus.

*The shuttle runs every hour, with a break from 7-8 p.m. See the full schedule below for details.

Stops include:

York Hill Campus

Mount Carmel Campus (New Road stop)

North Haven Campus

Whitney Village on Whitney Avenue

Shopping and Restaurant Shuttle - Hamden and North Haven

Wednesday, 5 - 9 p.m.

Friday, 6 - 11 p.m.

Saturday, 12 - 8 p.m.

Sunday, 1 - 7 p.m.

The shuttle runs to North Haven and Hamden shopping centers on Wednesday and Friday evenings and on weekends according to the schedule below.

The essentials you need are never far away. Our Shopping and Restaurant shuttle route connects students with shopping districts in both Hamden and North Haven, featuring grocery, clothing, box-store and craft stores, as well as a host of nationally known and local restaurants.

Stops include:

North Haven loop

Mount Carmel Campus (New Road stop)

Washington Avenue - near Stop and Shop, Dairy Queen, Bagelicious II and more shopping options

Universal Drive - multiple stops, near places like Target, Cinemark North Haven movie theater, Barnes and Noble and several restaurants

Hamden loop

Mount Carmel Campus (New Road stop)

Dixwell Avenue - multiple stops near Stop and Shop, Walmart, Marshalls, TJ Maxx, Staples and several restaurants

The Hamden shuttle runs on a 45-minute loop

The North Haven shuttle runs on a 1-hour loop

Wednesday

5 p.m. - 9 p.m. Friday

12 - 8 p.m. Sunday

Union Station/Downtown New Haven Shuttle

Friday, Saturday and Sunday evenings

The Union Station/Downtown New Haven shuttle route connects students with the heart of New Haven, featured shopping, dining, music and theater venues, cultural centers, museums and more. Union Station is a hub for train service by Amtrak, Metro-North Railroad and Shore Line East, so students can easily hop on to get places like New York City for a day trip, or Bridgeport where they can connect with the Port Jefferson Ferry.

The shuttle is available on weekends during the Fall semester, except during Thanksgiving Break.

Stops include:

Mount Carmel Campus

York Hill Campus

Union Station in New Haven

Church Street and George Street intersection in New Haven

University Breaks - Shuttle to Union Station in New Haven

Download the Shuttle App

To keep you on time, Valet Park of America, which services the shuttle system at Quinnipiac, maintains up-to-date shuttle information on its app, Passio GO. Simply download the app on your smartphone, and then search “Quinnipiac” in the app.

Download the app
